AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

description: Installation of an ATM to the right hand side of the shopfront
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Within 28 days of this approval detailed drawings showing the following modification to the scheme shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority:- Removal of the LED surround to the ATM. The development shall be completed and retained only in accordance with the modification thus approved.Reason: The LED illuminated surround is considered unsatisfactory in the form shown on the drawings submitted to date and as implemented and needs to be addressed within a reasonable time frame to ensure an acceptable form of development, sympathetic to local heritage, in accordance with Policies CS8 and DM12 of the Core Strategy 2012.

The development shall conform in all material aspects with the plans and   details shown in the application as listed below, subject to Condition 2 of this permission:N    NM_KUT_ATM_P - PROPOSED PLAN AND ELEVATIONS   Reason:  For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way. We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutorypolicies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

In accordance with the requirements of Local Government Act 1972 The Plans / Drawings / Documents submitted with the application are available on the Council's website. https://www.kingston.gov.uk/info/200155/planning_applications_and_permissions/263/find_a_planning_application_or_appeal
Spoke to agent and he is drawing up new plans and will submit

Please be advised that a fee of £234 is required for this application. This can be paid either online at www.kingston.gov.uk or by calling our Customer Service Team on 020 8547 5002this fee is both for advice and a meeting - if you only require one of these, the fee is £1250
